issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: Android: VideoPlayer: DoubleClick event on videoplayer not fired
fields.environment:
Tested with Titanium SDK: 2.1.1.v20120723131610
Tested with Titanium Â Studio: 2.1.1.201207161421
Android Device: Samsung GALAXY Note (2.3.6),LG P970 (2.2)
OS: Mac OSX 10.7.3

comments.body:
In the above test case, when we touch the screen, it will first toggle the media control which means the first touch event is intercepted. Therefore when we double click the screen, "dblclick" event won't be fired.
If we set "mediaControlStyle: Titanium.Media.VIDEO_CONTROL_HIDDEN" when creating the video player, the "dblclick" event works fine.
This is how videoplayer works. Mark the ticket invalid.
